utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: A crane collapsed in downtown Trenton.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't care.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My great-grandfather.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it's just a book he wrote. Open it up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Seriously, you're giving this to us?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a big step you're taking. I wanted to congratulate you. I understand that's the adult thing to do.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How did you know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've known for a while. The fact that you decided to cohabitate is not exactly a spoiler. Unless my intel is wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Trouble in paradise?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We have to get to Trenton.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: Young Woman
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That sound like a yes?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Sir, we have to get you to the O.R. You have a bad wound, but we're gonna pack it and transport you as fast as we can.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Skull fracture. Glasgow coma score of 11. She's immediate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Move on. This guy's dead.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: His wounds aren't so—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Forget the wound. Look at his toes. Atherosclerotic emboli. He'll never survive the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Maybe his shoes were too tight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not the shoes. Skin shows smoker's facies. He's not gonna make it till morning. He'll just take up an ambulance ride, surgeon's time, and an ICU bed.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He's expectant. Leave him.

utterance.speaker: Jay
utterance.content: I only nodded off for a second. I lost control of the load. I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Don't worry. We're gonna get you outta here.

utterance.speaker: Jay
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's secure.

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: Ready? Three, two, one.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Crane operator. Made it through amazingly well. Lucid and responsive. Stable fracture, right humerus. Haven't gotten to his lower half yet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell me when something hurts.

utterance.speaker: Jay
utterance.content: I fell asleep, killed all those people.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Something other than your conscience. Is that a pill in your pocket, or are you just happy to have a tiny pill-shaped penis?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Caffeine pills. You fell asleep taking these?

utterance.speaker: Jay
utterance.content: I drank two cups of coffee too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that normal for you?

utterance.speaker: Jay
utterance.content: No, I hate coffee. I'm working on no sleep. My daughter has the flu.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This much caffeine for a coffee virgin. There's no way he fell asleep. He passed out. Which means a neurological disorder caused the crash, not fatigue. Hey. We're taking the crane operator back to Princeton.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: They said he was barely hurt — he can wait.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Steal an ambulance. And call the team. Tell 'em we got a case.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House. No! I need you here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well he needs me there. And he moans louder than you do.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There were over 100 people in that building. Only 76 have been accounted for. Foreman and your team can handle the crane operator for now.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Having fun down there?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lots! Every time Cuddy leans over a patient, it's another opportunity for a down blouse nip slip. What's going on between her and Lucas?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Besides them moving in together? That's not enough for you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I gave her the housewarming gift earlier. And she paused for a split second, like she was hiding something.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's probably her moral revulsion at housewarming gifts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or maybe she didn't want to accept a gift for something she wasn't gonna do.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You actually think they're not moving in together?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What was that? You okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Vending machine collapsed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She still using your ex-wife as a realtor?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: As far as I know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, know a little farther, will you? Look into it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey! There's somebody down here!

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: If you can hear me, tap three times, or call out. Is anyone there?

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: I'm not getting anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I heard something — there's gotta be a void down there.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: There's a million voids down there. It was the parking garage. But equipment hasn't picked up any movement. Dogs haven't picked up any scent.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's smashed cars down there. The gasoline throw off their scent?

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Look, we gotta get back to work, okay? We'll get to this area soon. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anybody hear me? Hey! Anybody hear me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Aah! Oh...

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Help me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's your name?

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Please...my husband's gift. I was supposed to pick it up at the framers. It's on Elm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you should have told me earlier. I could have picked it up on the way. What's your name?

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: It's a picture from our Tortola trip. For his birthday.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not asking your name because I wanna become friends. I'm trying to gauge your mental state.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Hanna.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, that's a start. What day of the week is it?

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better still.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know that giant construction crane next door? It's kind of on top of you right now. Okay, I'm gonna try to pull you out.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Ow! My leg! Oh! Oh! Oh!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whew… I'm gonna need to get help.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: No, stay! Someone else will come.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No one knows I'm down here.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Please! Stay with me. Don't leave me in the dark.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: No! Don't leave me in the dark! Please stay!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's still in the ER House. We haven't had time to start a differential.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Perfect! Let's start right now. Put me on speaker. What causes syncope?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Your guy's stable. The two dozen other patients—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who don't need to be diagnosed. They just need to be bandaged. What causes syncope?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Vasovagal reaction...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Meningioma, sick sinus syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or you're wrong, and he just fell asleep.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How's he gonna sleep with 50 cups of coffee going through his veins?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Were you never a medical resident?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hear ten, eleven, and twelve. Where's Thirteen?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's not here. And the answer to your next question is no. I don't know

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you have the answer to my question after that? Space-occupying lesion in his brain is most likely. MRI will prove I'm right.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or it'll just prove he suffered head trauma from the crash.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which we'd wanna find anyway. Two birds with one scan. Do it.

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: Having trouble finding a vein for Hanna's IV.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She getting weaker? Paler?

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: No, no. She's stable.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That means her blood loss in minimal. Buys us some time. Get the IV into her tibia. It's almost hollow, feeds into the venous system. Which, they obviously don't teach you in EMT school.

utterance.speaker: Rescue Worker 1
utterance.content: This side's still leaning pretty bad. Gotta shore up this beam. What do ya got?

utterance.speaker: Rescue Worker 2
utterance.content: We need six 4 X 4s…..

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Told ya I'd be back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Heard you might be thirsty.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Ahhh...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I assume that bodes well for the rescue?

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Structural beam. High compression concrete. I can't break it up.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: You can't get me outta here?

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Naw. Just means we gotta move on to a different piece of equipment. I got airbags comin' in that'll lift 70 tons.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: What's your name?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You testing my mental state?

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: I'm gonna be stuck down here for a while. I'd like somebody to talk to.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Look, the guy who just left is the one who's gonna be holding your hand through all this. You talk to him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Little pinch.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Aah! Oh! Ow!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Big pinch.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: I gotta call my husband. Can I use your phone?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, no bars down here. L'chaim.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't worry. Fire marshal Bill will be back soon.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So I hope I didn't weird you out giving you that gift.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Can we talk about this later?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course. Is now later? Maybe things aren't going so well with Lucas. If so, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to step into anything.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There's no problems. We're doing just great.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So why the weirdness?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Can you help? When I opened it, I didn't think it was a housewarming gift. I thought it was an engagement present. It just happened last night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No wonder you wanna hide this from me... Since I'm such a delicate flower.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I didn't know what to say. And I've been slightly distracted.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That might make sense, 'cept you're not wearing the ring. So...You are hiding it, which begs the question—

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House...It's in my office drawer because I knew I was coming here. It's not weird. There's no mystery. I'm just getting married.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: 'Scuse me.

utterance.speaker: Jay
utterance.content: How much longer?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, less than a minute. Are you in any pain?

utterance.speaker: Jay
utterance.content: Nothing new. Just a little claustrophobic. Shouldn't you be taking care of those other people, the ones that I hurt?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Everything checks out okay.

utterance.speaker: Jay
utterance.content: My nose is bleeding.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's expected, given the trauma you've sustained.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's not expected.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: The way things fell, this support beam is now holding up a giant pile of rubble. We can't lift it without jeopardizing everyone down here. So it's time to discuss amputation.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Please listen to me. You’ve been down here almost two hours. By the time they clear away the rubble—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We are not cutting off her leg. You don't have to rush through this to make his job easier.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: You kidding me?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We leave the leg pinned, we're risking crush syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: What's that?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your leg isn't getting enough circulation. The longer it's pinned the more the muscle dies.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: So what does that mean, like a limp?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Dying muscles release poisons. We free your leg, the poisons rush back into your system. It could stop your heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So could cheeseburgers. Let's get your lazy friends to start moving that pile. She's got two more hours before crush syndrome could possibly set in.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: We're digging up there by hand. I can't guarantee I can get 10 tons of debris pulled off in two hours.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Well, you need to try. It's my leg.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: It's not just crush syndrome you gotta worry about, okay? There's gas leaks. There's fire. We can never rule out secondary collapses, no matter how much we shore this thing up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think chopping off someone's limb inside a pile of dirty rocks is safe? Sepsis, fat embolism, a hemorrhage.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Those risks are nothing compared to the risk of this thing coming down again.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Captain, he's a jerk. But it's what the patient wants. Can we please just give it a couple more hours?

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I gotta get up to triage.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Thank you, doctor?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: House. You don't need to thank me. It just makes sense.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Just promise me you won't let them cut off my leg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I promise. Does that make you feel better?

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: For some reason, it does.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Your phone is working down here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Switched carriers. Better rollover minutes. Talk.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: MRI was clean, but afterwards, he started bleeding out of his eyes and nose.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So there was something wrong before the collapse.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Unless it's just conjunctive coagulopathy from the trauma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah — you don't think he was sick before. We get it! You're wrong.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Brain infection?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sorry I'm late.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where were you?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Physical therapy. I left my phone in my locker.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The infection causes neurological symptoms, goes systemic, and D.I.C. causes the bleed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good theory. Except for the part that there's no fever. Get an X-ray venogram. See if you can find a reason for your existence. Also look for venous sinus thrombosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Would have seen it on the MRI.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not if you were too busy not looking for it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We should X-ray for a facial fracture first. This could all be simple trauma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just do what I tell you. Be back in ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: You're leaving?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's a dozen people here who can save you. I'm apparently the only one who can save this other guy.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: W–wait! Don't go.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hanna's freaking out. She's having a panic attack. She can't breathe. She's gonna rip out all her IVs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So calm her down.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She wants you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm flattered. Give her oxygen.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: They won't let O2 down there. Fear of explosion. You have to go back. She needs you, House.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: You only came back because I freaked out. Right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not at all. I just realized how... big and scary the world is and how cozy and safe this little place is.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Thank you. I'm sorry I needed you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Here. Call your husband.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Charlie? I'm here in... They called you? They're helping me. Are you coming? I don't know how this could happen. It's your birthday. I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See? This is why I lied about the phone. Your BP is spiking, so you're bleeding faster from your leg wound. I'm gonna have less time to save it. Hang up.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, they're telling me I have to go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was stupid of me.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: It was nice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't see that as a contradiction.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: He was already on his way. He was in Baltimore, and they all saw it on the news. How many people were hurt?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did I tell you about not raising your blood pressure?

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Can I ask what's wrong with your leg?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Crane fell on it. Small world.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: You could have just said no.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll remember that for my next human contact.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Would you pray with me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. I'm not in the habit of encouraging my patients' superstitions.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: How is that a habit? You plan on getting trapped under a building again?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't believe in God.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: I don't either. Please?

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: I always thought... If I did the right thing, if I treated people right, then good things would happen to me. You think that's how it works?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't use to. Then recently I tried... Now I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Good news.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Advancing catheter through interior jugular vein. You told House you were at therapy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Did you transcribe the entire meeting? Entering the cavernous sinus.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Your therapy's on Thursdays.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Got rescheduled. Injecting dye.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Really? I'm not gonna rat you out. We're friends. I Just wanna make sure you're okay.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No filling defects. Don't worry. I'm okay.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: You think we can be friends when I get outta here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. We'll catch a ball game or... group sex show or something.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Put the cribbing in there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, now when the beam starts lifting, you're gonna feel pain. It's gonna be like your foot's gone to sleep times a billion. You'll notice that I'm waiting till now to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: All right. We're ready.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Lifting.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: I'm feeling the pain already.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's good. That means the pressure's coming off. Much closer to getting out of here.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Aah!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on. Pull her out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: It's moving!

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Pull!

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Aahhh!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hanna! Hanna! What the hell happened?

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: I think the adjacent beam snapped during the lift. Mayday, mayday, mayday! We had a secondary collapse. We're all right. How are you guys?

utterance.speaker: Radio Answer
utterance.content: Rescue one, copy the mayday. Main tunnel is fine. Rescue's on the way.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Lift this up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: One, two, three—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kit. Gimme the kit.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No breath sounds on the left side. Tension pneumothorax. Okay, Hanna.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Uh...

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Hey. You better get back up top and make sure you didn't nick an artery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm gonna have to go.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: It's okay. You're all right.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're lucky this isn't worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know who's even luckier? You and just about every other human being who wasn't down there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did the venogram say?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Clean. Now the guy's starting to spike a fever.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Subarachnoid bleed.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Meningitis?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He didn't say his neck was sore.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's 'cause everything's sore. He just took a 15-story swan dive into concrete. Do an LP.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We also have to consider other infections.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you're suggesting we do an LP.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I guess I am.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Genius.

utterance.speaker: Captain McCreaney
utterance.content: Hey, bad news. Because of the collapse, we can't try the airbag again until we get everything off the top. Be five, six hours at least.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then we have to amputate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's been four hours already. It used to be a long shot. Now it's...crazy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Crush syndrome is basically a buildup of potassium. If we remove potassium—

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We're already treating with sodium bicarbonate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But not with glucose and Insulin. We have glucose in the kit. There's gotta be a diabetic here somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You wanna dose the insulin here in a non-hospital setting? That is insane! It's not worth it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? 'Cause I think I'm the only one here who knows what a leg is worth. And fortunately, you're not the one in charge — he is. And he knows that I'd testify against him if Hanna sues for cutting off a leg without exhausting every option.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Give us a minute?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know you're angry, but please don't put her life at risk just to get back at me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? Wow. So this is all about you now.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You took her side against me right after you heard about my engagement.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. That must be it. It's not that you're a pathetic narcissist.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't love you. So just... accept it and move on with your life instead of making everyone miserable.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's great. A life lesson from a middle-age single mom who's dating a man-child.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Screw you. I'm sick of making excuses for you. I'm sick of other people having to tiptoe around you and make their own lives worse while they try to keep you from collapsing. I'm done.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fantastic. Just stay away from my patient.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What are you clinging to, House? You're gonna risk her life just to save her leg? Really worked out well for you, didn't it? What do you have in your life, honestly? Tell me. I'm moving on. Wilson is moving on. And you... You've got nothing, House, nothing. I'm going down there, and I'm gonna convince her to let me cut her leg off. If you have any decency left, you'll stay out of it.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: No. Dr. House promised.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If there was any other way...

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: It doesn't hurt right now. I can wait.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Dr. House. Tell her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hanna... We have to amputate your leg.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: No. You said... that there was time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There was. And it's run out.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You asked me how I'd hurt my leg. I had a blood clot, and the muscle was dying. And I had all these doctors telling me I should amputate, and I said no, and they did this... very risky operation. I almost died.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: But you saved your leg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I wish I hadn't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They cut out a chunk of muscle about the size of my fist, and they left me with this, mutilated, useless thing. I'm in pain... Every day. It changed me. Made me a harder person, a worse person. And now... Now I'm alone. You don't want to be like me. You’ve got a husband who loves you. You have friends. You can start a family. You have a life. And this... This is just a leg.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can't put you out. It could depress your respiration too much. This should take away some of the pain.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Will it be quick?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll use a scalpel to slice through the skin, muscle, and fat. That should go pretty fast. Then I'll switch over to the electric saw when I get to the bone. It's two bones... About as thick as a broomstick. Takes about as long to get through. I'm gonna cut as close to the concrete, as I can, save as much of your limb as possible. Then the orthopedic surgeons back at the hospital will clean you up, have you fitted for a prosthetic. You'll be running circles around me in no time.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: How bad will it hurt?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like nothing you've ever felt before.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Aaaaah!

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Hanna.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: Baby. I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: You always loved my legs.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: I don't care about your legs. Baby, I love you. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's fallen into a coma. LP was clean, but...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are his vitals?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Excuse me, officer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you mean, officer? How long has there been a cop there?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't know. Ten minutes. He was being questioned when he fell into the coma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was anything else making him nervous or worried before his other symptoms?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He was claustrophobic right before the bleed and before the fever. We told him that he probably did fall asleep.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was his BP spiking?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But that didn't cause his first symptom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, it did. All the caffeine. We thought the problem was in his toilet — by that, of course, I mean his head. Which distracted us from the fact that it could have been just a clog in his sewer pipe, and by that, of course, I mean his spinal cord. And blah, blah, blah, blah. You get the idea.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: An arachnoid cyst on his lower spine. That's why we missed it. He's been sitting ten hours a day. Spiked his spinal fluid pressure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Run a CT—

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: BP's 72 over 42.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Hanna? Hanna?

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: Heart rate 148

utterance.speaker: Hanna
utterance.content: I can't breathe. I can't breathe.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Breath sounds bilaterally. It's not another pneumothorax. Neck vein’s flat. There's no tamponade. Damn it, I went in too high. Hanna, you've got a clot in your lung. I'm gonna fix this. IV streptokinase.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: What's happening. What's going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her body won't get any oxygen unless we can bust the clot. This is a blood thinner.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Is she gonna be all right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's gonna make her bleed more. We'll take care of that next.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not busting the clot.

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: Maybe it's her heart.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not a clot. It's a fat embolism. From the amputation.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Okay. So–so what can we do? Come on. Do something. Please, please, do something. Come on, guys, do something. Come on. Come on. Please, come on, do something! Come on, do something! Do something!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There's no way to prevent a fat embolism. Even if you'd done this in an O.R., you couldn't have saved her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You can't blame yourself for her death. This wasn't your fault.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's the point! I did everything right. She died anyway. Why the hell do you think that would make me feel any better?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You shouldn't be alone right now. You're bleeding.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm gonna give you a task as an employee. Get out of my way.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What's that?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm asking for some time off.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Obviously not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You going to leap across the room and grab them out of my hand?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. It's your choice if you want to go back on drugs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Just so you know, I'm finding it hard to see the downside.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You need to re-bandage your shoulder.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that why you're here? Foreman sent you?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You here to yell at me again?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I'm running out of ideas.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Lucas...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, great. You're feeling uncomfortable again. Probably means you just got back from some quickie wedding in Vegas or you're already pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I ended it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm stuck, House. I keep wanting to move forward. I keep wanting to move on, and I can't. I mean, my new house, with my new fiancé, and all I can think about is you. I just need to know if you and I can work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think I can fix myself?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause I'm the most screwed-up person in the world.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know. I love you. I wish I didn't. But I can't help it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How do I know I'm not hallucinating?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Did you take the Vicodin?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then I think we're okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.
